item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: rx33gundam
item.description:
I’m against piracy.

In Philippines… Poor Muslims and Pinoy pirate dvds, blu-ray, ps2, ps3, xbox 360, xbox, pc software, pc games etc…

I can’t miss them because there are so many of them! I always see them selling beside the streets whenever I go to school! I EVEN SEE POLICE BUYING AND NOT ARRESTING! The police do conduct raids… or should I say purposely failed raids because they are customers.

One day… someone knocked on our door… it was a muslim selling dvds and games for 20-80 Php(50php-1$). I was like WTF! They now go sell door-to-door!!! I didn’t buy any because I had a neighbor once who bought pirated dvds and pc games. I came to their house to see the quality of piracy. Some of the dvds suck but some were good but after a few days it couldn’t be played anymore. As for the pc games… when installed… their pc got flooded with viruses.

I don’t trust my life with the Philippine government with what’s happening now. When I grow up… I will make sure that I go to America. Simply because the gaming community is better and larger.

Here in the Philippines gaming is not appreciated and is considered to make you dumb. The only popular game here is DOTA. My classmates cut class just to play DOTA. I hate DOTA. It’s always about DOTA whenever I ask them to play. I was able to make them play L4D by treating them to an internet cafe. After 5 mins of gameplay… some of them liked it but most of them said it was boring and exited L4D to play DOTA. They even replace their girlfriends with DOTA! I mean… instead of accompanying a GF to her home… they play DOTA! It’s always about DOTA!

UGH! I’m sad here. I don’t have gaming buddies… or a GF. Never had one. Ever.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: nsane
item.description:
I know these reasons have been brought up before but, I’ll only pirate something for two reasons:

  1. can’t be bought here (less frequent thanks to services like steam)
  2. over-the-top DRM

There is nothing I can not stand more than buying a game than to be subject to install limits, SecuROM, and other bullshit DRM like that. Nothing turns me off to actually buying (which I buy 99% of all my stuff) something more than DRM.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: LoserMan255
item.description:
danielsangeo:

No, it isn’t. Stealing is the acquisition of a physical object that you neither paid for nor that you have permission to retain.

Pirating is the acquisition of a COPY that you neither paid for nor that you have permission to retain. The original is left intact with ownership retained with the original owner.

Stealing = Theft
Pirating = Copyright infringement

So, would there be any difference for you if you were a software developer that almost doesn’t have any money, because the internet is full of cheap bastards ?

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: mattemuse
item.description:
my up/dl ratio is always shit - even though i’m seeding, it seems like i rarely get uploads. is this a common problem and is there some way to fix it, or is it just the natural way torrents work and i have to put a ridiculous number of files up just so tons of people can get a few KB at a time and it adds up?

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: Schizophriend
item.description:
Bolteh:

Then buy them for PC to start with?

I just got a gaming PC in January. I had been a console gamer my whole life until then. :retard:
I’m going PC for everything except console exclusives nowadays. Never going back to consoles.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I think I’ve pirated only one game: Total Annihilation because I already bought it but the CDs got scratched beyond playability and I’m not about to pay the exorbitant costs associated with those third party sellers. I don’t pirate games because I figure that the developers spent a lot of money to create the game, market it, and distribute it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pirating VS Buying
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
LoserMan255:

Stealing and pirating is the same thing

No, it isn’t. Stealing is the acquisition of a physical object that you neither paid for nor that you have permission to retain.

Pirating is the acquisition of a COPY that you neither paid for nor that you have permission to retain. The original is left intact with ownership retained with the original owner.

Stealing = Theft
Pirating = Copyright infringement

Weird Al:

Once in a while
Well maybe you will feel the urge
To break
International copyright law

Read full topic
